title: Princess Diana steals the show as The Crown recreates royal trip Down Under

With the iconic bob, bold eighties power shoulders and a coy sideways glance, Emma Corrin recreates Princess Diana with eerie accuracy.

The actress, 23, had Di’s mannerisms down to a T as she recreated her 1983 royal tour of Australia while filming for The Crown.

Scenes showed how the beloved princess was flocked by fans waving Australian flags on the tour, which she took with then-husband Prince Charles and baby William - though filming actually took place Spain.

Emma previously told of her excitement over landing the role, adding: “Princess Diana was an icon and her effect on the world remains profound and inspiring”.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: Getty)

God’s Own Country actor Josh O’Connor, 29, stars as Charles in the Netflix series.

In April it was announced that Emma had landed the coveted part.

Confirming the news, she said she was "over-joyed, over the moon and incredibly honoured."

"I have been glued to the show and to think I'm now joining this incredibly talented acting family is surreal," she wrote on Instagram .

(Image: SplashNews.com)

"Princess Diana was an icon and her effect on the world remains profound and inspiring.

"To explore her through Peter Morgan's writing is the most exceptional opportunity and I will strive to do her justice."

The unknown 23-year-old was selected for the plum role after show bosses were impressed with her ability to capture the look of the young Lady Diana Spencer in her days as a Sloaney teenager working as a nanny.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Insiders on the Netflix mega-hit say the young British actress is “the double” of Lady Di in the early 80s, the point at which she began dating Prince Charles.

"Emma is a brilliant talent who immediately captivated us when she came in for the part of Diana Spencer.

"As well as having the innocence and beauty of a young Diana, she also has, in abundance, the range and complexity to portray an extraordinary woman who went from anonymous teenager to becoming the most iconic woman of her generation," The Crown creator Peter Morgan said.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

An advert to attract a “staggeringly talented” young actress to the role, said it would involve being able to flirt and be a “social exhibitionist on the world stage”.

But as well as the “charming comedy”, Corrin will also portray the Princess in darker times, as a “desperate and lonely self-harmer at her lowest ebb”.

They were seeking “the kind of psychological intensity of Mia Farrow in Rosemary’s Baby”.

Cambridge-educated Emma, who had a small part in a 2014 episode of ITV's Granchester, will appear in the fourth series of the Royal drama, due for release at the end of next year, alongside The Durrells star Josh O’Connor as her husband and the future king.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

The 10 episodes, also featuring Olivia Colman as the Queen, will cover the couple's “happy period” charting their courtship and marriage up to 1986.

The third series, written by Peter Morgan and featuring Charles in his 20s will start streaming this weekend.

Other cast already revealed include Helena Bonham as Princess Margaret and Call the Midwife actress Emerald Fennell as young Camilla Parker-Bowles, who is seen flirting with him at a polo match in 1975.

Actress Marion Bailey has also been confirmed for the part of the Queen Mother.
